posts.content:
Swift Longbow Devastator 

This is an interesting and probably viable build idea I came up with whilst brewing my morning coffee.

Stealthy, speedy, elven ranged dev critter, huge AB and damage boosts from AA. 

Takes a leaf out of Stagmeister's Wyse (Monk / Wiz / AA) build but adds dev crit and a few more wizard levels for some caster levels and a craft wand/extend spell feat.

Ends up with a Base AB of 49. 

Uncanny dodge would have been nice but one can't have everything.

Just run away, shoot their legs, and run circles around em with up to 6 APR with haste/rapid shot plus the damage boosts from enchant arrow XIII (+13) / str damage / devastating critical. 

Magic is going to be a problem (ie Bigby's) but unless you are a proper spell resistant monk it's always going to be.

Maybe just keep your distance, stealthy approach, two attack flurry, then RUN. 

Maybe you'll get a dev crit off with a 19-20 / 18-20 threat range for those nasty spell slingers? :)

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Monk/AA is one of my favourite builds, although I usually go for either Monk9/Wiz2/AA29 or Monk10/Wiz3/AA27 and ignore casting.

If you're going for Craft Wand then Monk10/Wiz7/AA23 could be worth considering for level 4 wands, although your AB and damage will suffer slightly.
I would recommend going generalist instead of illusionist since enchantment has a couple of useful spells like Balagarn's and Mass Haste which can be more useful than an extra True Strike slot. Most of your buffs will be from wands anyway so the extra spell slots aren't as useful as the extra flexibility in my opinion, although obviously this depends on what is available on your server.
You should move Rapid Shot to level 3 and WF to level 6, the increased APR is very useful at low levels.
The 3 points in Listen should be moved to Search or Spot, currently they're a waste.

Everything else looks great for a smooth levelling build.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Yunim, I like the comments you've made
Not sure what I was thinking not taking lvl 4 wizard spells for wands for stoneskin, lesser spell breach and improved invisibility are extremely handy to have
Forgot about mass haste and enchantment, that spell is mandatory on any speedy

I put listen in there early, its there for a bit of early detection until the large spot dump
I think I was aiming for a score of about 20 odd for a bit of detection around corners combined with the d20 rolls from constant detection from keen senses, its basically +10 to detection plus the racial feat bonuses, I could probably drop spot down a tad

Plenty of good advice here!
I prefer more AA and less Wizard too, but I understand how a WoG player wants Craft wand and level 4 spells in.
Another option, at least for other scenarios, is to use a sequencer robe and cast defensive spells on it from scrolls. That gives you a "free spell book" with those spells stored in the sequencer every day. You only need to be able to cast from scrolls, so it is even possible with a Monk10/Wiz 1/AA29 or Monk9 Wiz1/AA30 build.
 As for the build, I would drop Toughness and maybe even Called shot. After all you are supposed to be able to outrun the foes to begin with. That let you clear two epic feat slots.
